oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Random Reordering in SOR-Type Methods
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Oswald, Peter
Zhou, Weiqi
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Numerical Analysis
65F10, 15A60
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: When iteratively solving linear systems By=b with Hermitian positive semi-definite $B$, and in particular when solving least-squares problems for $Ax=b$ by reformulating them as $AA^\ast y=b$, it is often observed that SOR-type methods (Gauss-Seidel, Kaczmarz) perform suboptimally for the given equation ordering, and that random reordering improves the situation on average.This paper is an attempt to provide some additional theoretical support for this phenomenon. We show eerror bounds for two randomized versions, called shuffled and preshuffled SOR, that improve asymptotically upon the best known bounds fro SOR with cyclic ordering. Our results are based on studying the behavior of the triangular truncation of Hermitian matrices with respect to their permutations.
